Package http.server

Class WebServer

java.lang.Object
http.server.WebServer
public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
Example program from Chapter 1 Programming Spiders, Bots and Aggregators in Java Copyright 2001 by Jeff Heaton WebServer is a very simple web-server. Any request is responded with a very simple web-page.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jeff Heaton

    • WebServer

      public WebServer()

  • Method Details

    • readContentType

      public void readContentType() throws java.io.IOException
      Read the file which contains a table of correspondence of type and MIME. Then we stock them in a hashMap.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • readState

      public void readState() throws java.io.IOException
      Read the file which contains a status code of correspondence of statusCode and statusMessage. Then we stock them in a hashMap.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • readFile

      public void readFile​(java.lang.String filepath) throws java.io.IOException
      Read a file by using the method read. So we don't need to separate the case of a textual file or the other files.
      Parameters:
      filepath - The path of the file. In our application, the file we want to read is stocked at ./resource
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • readImg

      public void readImg​(java.lang.String filepath) throws java.io.IOException
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • responseHeadHandle

      public void responseHeadHandle​(java.lang.String type, int stat)
      Output the Header of the response by using the content-type and status code given
      Parameters:
      type - the content-type which we want to response to the client
      stat - the status code of the response

    • handleDynamic

      public java.lang.String handleDynamic​(java.lang.String data1, java.lang.String data2) throws java.io.IOException
      Handle the dynamic resource by using our program. Give two numbers to add and return their sum.
      Parameters:
      data1 - one number to add(String)
      data2 - another number to add(String)
      Returns:
      the sum of the two number(String)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • get

      public void get​(java.lang.String path) throws java.io.IOException
      Implementation of the methode get. The user give the URL path and the we search the file correspond in the server. Then we read the file and response to the client by the file we read. The difference of the url and filePath in our system is we stock the file in a repository ./resource But the client doesn't need to because it will be too complicate.
      Parameters:
      path - The url path which the client entered. It does not contain the hostname and the port of the server
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • head

      public void head​(java.lang.String path) throws java.io.IOException
      Implementation of the methode head. The user give the URL path and the we search the file correspond in the server. Then we read the file and response to the client with just the head but not the content of the file. The difference of the url and filePath in our system is we stock the file in a repository ./resource But the client doesn't need to because it will be too complicate.
      Parameters:
      path - The url path which the client entered. It does not contain the hostname and the port of the server
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • put

      public void put​(java.lang.String path, byte[] body) throws java.io.IOException
      The implementation of the methode put The client update or create a file to the server by using the path given by the client. The file on the server will be replaced totally by the file the user send.
      Parameters:
      path - The url path which the client entered. It does not contain the hostname and the port of the server
      body - The content of the file which we want to put on the server.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • delete

      public void delete​(java.lang.String path) throws java.io.IOException
      The implementation of the methode delete The client delete a file on the server by using the path given by the client. The Location of the file is strictly defined by the client. So the path Url and the path of the server is exactly the same.
      Parameters:
      path - The url path which the client entered. It does not contain the hostname and the port of the server
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • post

      public void post​(java.lang.String path, byte[] body) throws java.io.IOException
      The implementation of the methode post The client update or create a file to the server by using the path given by the client. The file which the server send will be append to the original file if it exists..
      Parameters:
      path - The url path which the client entered. It does not contain the hostname and the port of the server
      body - The content of the file which we want to post on the server.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Start the application.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line parameters are not used.
